description: From Middle English juelrye, from Old French juelerye, equivalent to jewel +â€Ž -ery.

entries.meaning: Collectively, personal ornamentation such as rings, necklaces, brooches and bracelets, made of precious metals and sometimes set with gemstones.
examples: She had more jewellery ornamented about her than any three ladies needed.
Synonyms: (Cockney rhyming slang) tom, (Cockney rhyming slang) tomfoolery
